sections.sectionTitle: 1. This is how you keep your costs under control even

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Today, we’ll talk about how to manage your mobile costs while traveling abroad with Wingo. Our goal is to explore travel options, roaming limits, and how to stay connected without surprises.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: That sounds useful! I’ve heard about unexpected roaming charges. How can I avoid them?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Great question! Wingo offers practical travel options for almost every tariff zone. These options are valid for 12 months and can be managed directly in your customer portal, myWingo. Just book the option for at least 30 days, and you can cancel daily afterward.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: How do I know how much data or calling time I’ve used?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: You can check your usage anytime in myWingo. It’s simple and ensures you stay within your limits.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: Can I set a roaming limit for additional safety?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Yes, you can set a roaming limit, but it must be at least as high as the international option you’ve booked. This ensures you can make calls and surf abroad. Plus, you can change your roaming limit for free, even when traveling.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: What are these international options, and how do I know which countries fall into which group?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Countries are grouped into five zones for international calls. For instance, Group 1 includes countries like Germany, USA, and Italy, while Group 2 includes Australia and New Zealand. You can find the full list in the roaming tool in myWingo. It tells you the cost of calling between countries.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: How do I activate a travel option for my Wingo Mobile subscription?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Activating options is easy! Log into myWingo, select 'Add option,' and choose what you need. Alternatively, you can use the Wingo Cockpit, which is accessible anytime, even while abroad, free of charge.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: What if I use Wingo Swiss? Can I still use data in the EU or UK?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Wingo Swiss is designed for unlimited use within Switzerland. For data or calls in the EU or UK, you’ll need to book a travel option. For example, you can get 500 MB of data for 9.90 CHF, valid for 12 months.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: What about Wingo Europe Pro? Can I use that abroad?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: With Wingo Europe Pro, you can make unlimited calls, send messages, and use 40 GB of data within the EU/UK. After 40 GB, your speed reduces to 200 kbit/s. For other countries, travel options are available.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: Can I use Wingo services on ships, planes, or ferries?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, outgoing calls and data use on ships, planes, or ferries aren’t possible. But you can use the Wi-Fi provided by airlines, ships, or ferries if available.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: What devices support Full Speed 5G with Wingo?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: Full Speed 5G works with smartphones, tablets, smartwatches, and wearables, as long as the device is 5G-capable and you’re in a 5G-covered area.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: Which subscriptions allow Full Speed 5G?

dialogues.speaker: expert
dialogues.text: All Wingo Mobile subscriptions support Full Speed 5G, except for Wingo Prepaid. If you have a prepaid plan, this option isn’t available.

dialogues.speaker: learner
dialogues.text: Which network does Wingo use?
